storyInfo: The Pope negotiates with Empress Ewigegnade, and Federico takes Arturia away. Ebenholz decides to return to Urtica Grafschaft together with Lessing. Viviana also finds her own path. Yet the Witch King's true parting words were—danger is close at hand.

attributes.text: You're hurt.
Am I? That new Arts teacher is so scary. Maybe I got bruised by him during training earlier.
It hurts.
Does it? It's nothing. The Arts in our bodies will heal our wounds in no time.
Hm... Why are you crying, Hildegard? Haven't you been injured far worse than this before?
No, we can't.... we shouldn't be treated like this.
Hand me the wooden sword. I'll go look for that caster.
I'll go find Leopold and everyone who treats us like creations instead of recognizing us as people with feelings.
And what are you going to do after that?
Resist.
You might not even achieve anything.
That's fine. I just need to prove something to them all, to you, and to myself.
Which is?
That I'm alive. And that my sorrow, my joy, my pain, my love, and my life... that they definitely mean something.

attributes.content: It's beautiful... just like it always has been.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: It's getting colder lately. Autumn will be over in a month or two. But Zwillingstürme doesn't tend to see any snow, so the sunset won't wane.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: This is surreal. You're definitely not the type to soliloquize while appreciating the view.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What I'm trying to say is that there are no longer any traces of unrest, after just half a month.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The Twin Spires tower over us as usual, the clouds are as splendid as always, and the people pass by both Gnade Avenue and Macht Avenue as if... nothing happened at all.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: No, something has changed. We can't ignore that.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: How are your injuries?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The old man said it's nothing serious, but you did stay in Kargereich for a bit too long, so it's hard to say if you're completely free of corrosion.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I haven't had any more headaches since then, at least.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You're braver than I imagined, Ebenholz. You've saved so many people.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I just... couldn't allow those 'echoes' haunting me to hurt any more people.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You met the Witch King, and whether you cursed or killed him, you've already completed 'the last thing you could still do.'
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: So what's next for you?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I hope I'm not intruding on you both.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Herr Ebenholz, I was looking for you... on Grimmacht's behalf.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: And here I thought it would be Ewigegnade to send you to punish a 'dead man' for coming back to Leithanien without permission.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What's this?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Grimmacht handed me two secret letters.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: One calling for your return to Zwillingstürme, and the other granting you a final choice.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Have you been staying in the spire the whole time since the incident?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Officially, there are still two Kaiserinnen in Leithanien. Grimmacht is just away for the time being, and someone has to handle the mountain of paperwork she left behind.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Only I can do it, as I always have.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: You're set on that?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Leithanien might have only one single Spire in the future.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I came to Zwillingstürme to meet with the Kaiserinnen seven years ago. Ewigegnade didn't like my performance, my caution, or maybe my status as Lupukarn's representative... It was Grimmacht who saved me.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: And it didn't end there. I am her Voice, even if she didn't, and now never will, appoint me as one for real.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: You, me, and even some of the nobility—many Leithanians believe in the path Grimmacht was seeking, right?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: It might lead us to an era where we won't need Spires at all. There's still so much more we can do.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: The way you're talking...
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You've matured since the last time I saw you, Michael.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Erm, that's because... I'm a growing boy, after all.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Herr Ebenholz, I see you're done reading the letters, so I'll take my leave now.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Whatever your answer is, I hope you'll be happy with it.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Your expression is a little hard to read.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Grimmacht gave me two options.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I could get another death certificate. Not just as 'Graf Urtica,' but also as a 'Leithanian'... By dying, I will obtain true freedom.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Or... I could return to the Urtica Grafschaft.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Let me tell you a story.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: There was once a young boy...
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I'm not very good at telling stories, but just listen to me.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The boy's family served as retainers to a certain aristocracy for generations. From one generation to the next, the retainers fought on the nobles' behalf, shedding blood, vying for glory, and bearing any rebukes for them.
Until a certain noble came along. Birth, tradition, systems... He saw them all as worthless. Everyone looked the same to him: mediocre, frail, and shallow.
So with a piece of paper, he removed the status of every retainer working for his family, and the boy's family obtained their freedom.

Afterwards, the noble became the most controversial ruler in the history of the country. His crimes eventually eclipsed his accomplishments, his Spire was toppled, and the empire ushered in a new age.
Many decisions made during his lifetime were also overruled, including the decree to remove his retainers' shackles.

One day, the young boy was told that the deposed king's descendant was granted leniency by the new Kaiser, and had regained his family's territory. He was told he needed to rush back to the spire, to meet his master...
Fate seemed to only turn a corner before coming right back again.

But in the end, the boy never managed to enter the spire. The newly arrived noble refused to sign the documents that could get him his servant back. This new noble, as they said, was also a boy around his age...
Once again, the boy obtained 'freedom.'
The boy's name was Lessing Maeyer. And that newly arrived noble was you, Ebenholz, the twelve year old Graf Urtica.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You'll never remember it, so don't bother trying.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Back then I was so full of anxiety, afraid that someone was playing a prank on me, so I asked a servant to find out what was going on.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: She said: 'The young Graf's migraines seem to be upsetting him again. He chased all the attendants out of his room, with many documents scattered across the floor.'
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Don't take this as grumbling about some 'fateful arrangement.' I'm just telling the truth about how one unintentional move from you changed someone else's entire life.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You spurned your identity, as well as the regrets and suffering you bore from it. Of course, I'm sure you know better than anyone else how real your pain was.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: But at the same time, I hope you also know their value.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: And how we should regard them.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Danke, for telling me all this, even though you were positively awful at it.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Have I ever mentioned what I experienced back at the Genesis Horn?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Nein.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I didn't think it worth bringing up before, but I suppose I can tell you what I didn't get to tell the Witch King, before he vanished in front of my eyes.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You have no heir. I'm merely a descendant who shares the name Urtica.
Before your time, it had yet to carry either honor or so-called disgrace.
This changed because of you alone. So I will change it once more, but never by the same means you used.
This is my way of mocking you.
This is my shame, my cage.
This is my duty, my obligation.
This is my path.
So you had already decided back then?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Then why did you make that face earlier, while you were reading the Kaiserin's letters?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Because there are still other matters, which have suddenly became somewhat tricky to deal with.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ebenholz!!!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I finally found you!!!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Hibiscus...?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Have you forgotten who you are?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You're a Rhodes Island Operator. I'm sure you've read the operator manual you got after onboarding, right? Carefully, from cover to cover?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: 'I invite all of you to witness how two centuries of sin will come to a conclusion... How fortunate it is, that this day of farewell has finally arrived! ...For I have seen my life's path ahead of me, crystal clear...'
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: What's that she reading?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Operators must go through a strict approval process whenever they apply to leave the landship. How could you just run off after leaving that unintelligible letter?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I haven't even had time to hand it in yet.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: ...Give it back, Hibiscus.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'll be staying in Leithanien for the foreseeable future. I'll return to the Urtica Grafschaft.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: As I'd like to resubmit my application to disembark, could you please help me to—
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Erm, you'd better go see the Doctor or Kal'tsit in person for that.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Is the landship nearby?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: How else would I be here? It's not that close, but we do have some business nearby to handle.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You don't seem at all surprised to hear that I want to return to Urtica. We've been on edge ever since we left Vyseheim...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That's because you weren't gnashing your teeth spouting nonsense this time. Which means you've thought this through.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Zwillingstürme, Bachshof, Bach Street
Viviana looks at the courtyard before her.

It is not large by any measure, but still well maintained. The low stone steps surrounding the planted vegetation have been removed and enclosed with a waxy white oak fence, presumably to prevent the homeowners from tripping over them.
A small house sits quietly in the center, embraced by the grass. Freshly painted white walls reflect the morning sun, casting the climbing vines in a radiant glow.
Come in, Viviana.
You made it.
When Bach was presiding over the Glorreiches Kapitalprojekt, he specially patterned this street after the one he lived in as a child. Doesn't it bear a striking resemblance to Marigold Alley?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Two years ago, a Markgraf returned to their territory to recuperate from illness, so Cora bought this place, but never moved in.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: It was only after you came to the city that she asked me to come help clean the place up.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: So, how does it look?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: It's lovely. Only... these vines don't have to be trimmed so much.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Let them grow as they please, or they'll look somewhat stiff.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: ...There's no need to hold back your thoughts, Viviana.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Herr Reiner, this is the first time I'm seeing your face.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's been so many years.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: This is the first time I've taken off the Gesatzswächter mask and shown my true face to anyone else, not since I came to Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: It's my identity, my duty, and... my everything.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: I guess a Gesatzswächter shouldn't be reminiscing about the mastermind who spoiled Das Kaiserinnensfest and tampered with the Güldenesgesatz.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Herr Reiner, about what happened that day...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: There's no need to blame yourself, Viviana.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: Whenever Cora set her heart on something, she would never look back. You could only be dragged along with her.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: Her eyes were already going when she joined the Reichsorchester on Werner's recommendation that year. I promised Werner I'd do my best to help the girl he saved.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: But I gradually came to discover that she had her own feelings, her own judgements, her own desires.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: She wanted to help Lucinda, to save Werner, and even to modify the Güldenesgesatz. She wanted to ensure that the kindhearted people would never be tormented by their own regrets ever again.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: She was... a resolute woman, and I've always respected her.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: But she was even more courageous than I had thought.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: Mhm...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: And so, her fate is sealed.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: If it were me...
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: I... I can't even imagine how it would feel.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: ...Thank you, Viviana.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: Have you made your decision?
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: I went to see Ewigegnade before coming here, and formally declined her offer to become an Empresses' Voice.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: As per protocol, new recruits have to enter the Spires after the Celebration and accept Their Majesties' appointment before they can officially assume their positions.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But Her Majesty Grimmacht has just 'lost her voice,' and this year's appointment ceremony has been cancelled, so it's an appropriate time to submit my refusal.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: If this is what you've decided on, then I have nothing to say.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: It's just that, Werner...
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: Viviana, this was the best, and last, thing he could arrange for you.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: Don't blame your father. He just lacked the freedom to do otherwise.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: My father... let me and my mother down, but he protected so many others.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Cora in the Witch King's Spire, House Hochberg which could have been implicated at any moment, and the countless people of Sturmland forced into a difficult position by a copy of the Güldenesgesatz.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: From beginning to end, he was caught up in the vortex of his time. He witnessed, experienced, lost, was powerless to change anything, and could only do his utmost to fend off the storm.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: He never left a single line, but regardless, this is a poet's way of writing about himself.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Viviana...
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: I'm glad you feel that way, child.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: Whether sending me to Kazimierz or arranging my appointment as an Empresses' Voice, it was never because he thought the paths he chose for me were good.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: He simply saw me as a child in need of constant protection, a job at which he failed to excel.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: So I don't blame him.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Then I presume you won't be returning to Sturmland either.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: In Kazimierz, I felt like a stranger. The bright neon lights, the noisy arenas, the priced battles, as well as the glory and honor... they were never a part of me.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But when I returned to Sturmland, to Zwillingstürme, that feeling never went away.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: To me, Leithanien is just the candles and books I had back in those dark nights. The marigolds in bloom everywhere. They also symbolize 'parting.'
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I've always been able to make my own choices.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...Choices.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: People can only truly face their own weaknesses when they have options.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: Herr Reiner...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's nothing.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: After Das Kaiserinnensfest, you said you needed to inform your friends in Kazimierz about your experience in Kargereich.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: I've already sent a letter. I should be receiving a reply soon.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: And after that?
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: 'To the lighthouses. To where once they were.'
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.content: Just a line from a book I read when I was young.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Allow me to bid you farewell. Lebewohl, Herr Reiner.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Lebewohl.
attributes.name: Brandt

attributes.text: Goodbye, Cora.
Goodbye, Zwillingstürme.

attributes.content: Frau Droste! Phew—
attributes.name: Messenger

attributes.content: Frau Droste, the 'Nearl' you've been waiting two weeks for is finally here. Just up ahead at the crossing.
attributes.name: Messenger

attributes.content: Madam Viviana Droste.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Mr. Młynar...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The Nearl family has received your correspondence. I just happened to be near Leithanien, so I came as soon as I could.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: In your letter, you mentioned seeing, and even touching, a campaign knight's swordspear with the Nearl family crest.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Tell me everything.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: So, this is the melody of the present moment?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Indeed.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: What you're hearing are all the emotions I'm feeling.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...It's no different from what I usually hear.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The people of Zwillingstürme love you, after all.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: And you love them too.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: This has never changed.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You were there too, when I returned to reality from the Genesis Horn.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Perform the melody back then for me, Sankta.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: That's impossible.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: I cannot record the moment the tear rolled down your cheek. If it did not fall into the depths of your soul to bloom into fruition, then it was merely a drop of water impossible to retain, evaporated by the sun as it fell.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...I see.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The year this spire was built, a scholar gave a public lecture at the Leithanian Academy of Arts. He claimed that people born from Arts lack an innate soul.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The very next day, he received... a transfer, a promotion normally impossible for him to obtain in his lifetime: becoming the Kaiserin's attendant.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Unfortunately, he passed just a year later from overworking himself in the depths of the spire. Though he left behind a scholarly magnum opus before his death, overturning all of his previous opinions.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Would you like to have a look at it, Sankta? The writing is mediocre, so I did not allow its publication. But the emotions contained within are... actually quite interesting.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Are you... planning to lock me up in your spire, too?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Who let you in, Sankta?
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: The Kaiserin has not approved your audience!
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Bring him over.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Executor Federico of the Laterano Notarial Hall. I have recently submitted several requests to the Empresses' Voices for an audience.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: So you're... the Lateran Saint.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: I am here to recover the fugitive Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Your sister has done many things in Leithanien.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Former Reichsorchester Tuner Cora Löwenstein and the remnants of the Witch King—
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...Cora? No, I'm not talking about that.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The Ludwigs-Universität case concluded long ago. Das Kaiserinnensfest did go through some incidents, but the final performance was satisfactory.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: I'm sure you've seen the whole thing, Herr Saint. I hope Leithanien's might and magnificence will leave a deep impression on you, even after you leave.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Am I to take your statement as such: 'Leithanien is prepared to refuse any procedural communication with Laterano over Arturia and her criminal offences'?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Are you questioning my decision?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Federico hears the sound of swords and floor colliding.
He lifts his head and looks at the Empress of Leithanien.
Ewigegnade stands in the sunset's afterglow, her long skirt infused with a warm gold. But behind her lies a long hallway comprised of shadows.
He counts dozens of Gesatzswächter standing at attention in silence, their swords resounding.
Federico Giallo. Don't move just yet.
Hm?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And what is this? An Arts device... A Lateran made drone?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: I'm just a little machine.
attributes.name: 'Unique Drone Model'

attributes.content: On some occasions, you can also treat me as a Messenger.
attributes.name: 'Unique Drone Model'

attributes.content: And to whom do you belong?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: I belong to... Laterano.
attributes.name: 'Unique Drone Model'

attributes.content: There is someone who wishes to speak with you, Empress of Leithanien.
attributes.name: 'Unique Drone Model'

attributes.content: Long time no see, Ewigegnade.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: ...Your Holiness.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Your Majesty, Arturia Giallo has been taken away.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Yes, I saw.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: If you wish to keep her here, then we shall not let them leave so easily, even if Yvangelista XI himself were to show up in person.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Of course you wouldn't.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: However, that aging Pope has brought us a message.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: He said that... 'Disaster' is imminent. And when the time comes, Laterano won't be the only nation affected. He hopes for Leithanien and Laterano to cooperate and overcome this crisis together.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: His usual rhetoric then.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Herkunftshorn said something similar.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Within the chaos, right before the illusory throne he had created for himself.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: He said, 'hope is already lost, and eternity is no more'.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: And then, after that, I saw them with my own eyes... The enemy hibernating within the chaos.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: At one point, they came infinitesimally close to our Leithanien.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: ...Give us the order, and we will bring the Sankta back for you.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: No, not just her. We will do anything, no matter the cost... Whatever it takes to find a way to re-enter that chaotic space and bring Grimmacht back.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Hildegard...
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: In the final moment before the Genesis Horn completely disintegrated, I raised my shield, protecting the twin spires and everyone beneath... but not her.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: ...What?!
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Brandt, watch this sunset with me.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: I asked her if she wanted to know why.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: If she wanted to ask why I let everything be, even though I knew it would turn out as it did.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Or to ask me why... I turned my back on her at the very last moment.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: But she didn't.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: She didn't even hesitate to do what she normally does, turning to face the enemy head on.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: As we passed each other, her final words were to wish that...
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: ...I could have this sunset, as I wanted.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Grimmacht... is a great ruler.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: We will never forget her sacrifice, and continue the fight for Leithanien's future.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: So you've made your decision too.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: ...Yes, Your Majesty.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Very good, Brandt.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Herkunftshorn built a spire in that impossible chaos, naming it after the tower that has long since crumbled in reality.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: He declared that it would stand eternal.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Therefore, I can achieve the same. No, I can surpass it, even.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: I will keep this sunset for all eternity.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: It will bathe Leithanien, and everything that will belong to Leithanien, in Eternal Grace.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: That's the last of it. It's not like you'll be able to stuff the spire down your pocket if you keep staring at it, you know!
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: ...But is that truly impossible?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Professor!
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Alright, alright, don't glare at me like that. I'll return the statue I got from the Beschwörung classroom's entrance, if it comes down to it.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: You put that thing in my cube-thing?!
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: What? It's valuable, you know. I spilled Feranmut blood all over it a century ago!
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Let's... get a move on. The rest of us are going, even if you aren't.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Ermengarde, are we really...
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: There's no way a Lich can become a Leithanian. Shouldn't you know that better than anyone else, having been here the longest?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: The Sarkaz have always wandered this land, and us Liches have always been the nomads of our people.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: We walk the land collecting and guarding knowledge. We protect our tradition from war and strife, so we leave the moment the place we're at isn't stable anymore.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: And Leithanien's about to undergo some radical changes. Grimmacht stayed behind in the chaos, so there's no one left to hold Ewigegnade back.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Heh... Herkunftshorn, you damn codger. You ought to die a thousand more deaths for the mess you've left us. Feel like coming back to life again and wipe your own behind?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: An impossible feat even if you were to say yes. And if such an opportunity did exist, we should leave it to the more sprightly youngsters anyway.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Do you mean there's a chance for Grimmacht to... Have you come up with a way to enter Kargereich?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Easy now, it won't happen so soon.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: But Herkunftshorn was right. The time of annihilation is nigh.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Where will us Liches find our place when the entire land is beset by calamity?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: And that's why we shouldn't bother ourselves with all that trouble. Our nomad days shall come to an end.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Alright, then where to next?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Where else?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Tell your new friends at Kazdel that the Lich King’s Court... No, not the court—tell them that the keepers of the Temple of Knowledge are preparing to return home.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: The special correspondence with Ewigegnade is over. I shared Laterano's caution and, once again, offered my hopes of advancing together with Leithanien.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: When the time comes, we will further analyze the incident in Zwillingstürme according to the information brought back by Federico Giallo.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: It was clearly more than just a revolt instigated by the remnants of the Witch King.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Perhaps what happened there was a harbinger of the Disaster, much like the warning Laterano received.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Ewigegnade, the only Empress of Leithanien with a voice now... The way she spoke was appropriate enough, and her attitude sufficiently ambiguous. I could even imagine her expressions.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: ...All within my expectations.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: The Lateran Declaration didn't really receive any practical response after the Summit of Nations. From the furthest coastlines to the centrum, the Disaster remains a secret in many countries.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Faith unites Laterano, while division has always been an everlasting blight upon this great land. But if we wait until the Disaster connects all nations into one...
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: It will be too late.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: We already have a vague outline of what we're facing, but are we still unable to deduce its source?
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.text: Analysis complete. Threat level at maximum.
\n\nDisaster unknown. Path simulation failed.
\n\nLaterano... synchronized outbreak.

attributes.content: Laterano will accelerate the development of yet more emergency response mechanisms.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: ...I need to reconfirm the list of suitable personnel.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: That settles the formalities of the handover.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: In accordance with the bilateral agreement between Laterano and Leithanien, the Empresses' Voice and I will ensure that Arturia Giallo returns to Leithanien when necessary.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: The aforementioned agreement has been confirmed.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Phew... that's it.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I guess this is goodbye for real.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Michael, feel free to come find me anytime, whether I'm in Laterano or on Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Huh? This is new, Herr Executor. What's with the human touch in your words today?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Human touch? A uselessly vague descriptor.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I just have... an intuition.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: This incident has not yet been fully resolved. To be more precise, what we experienced was just the beginning.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You're here at last, Federico.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The Empress let you go, but that does not mean I can immediately take you away. The handover procedure was somewhat more tedious than planned.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Fine work, I assume.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You heard Herkunftshorn's final words within the chaos.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What exactly did he tell you?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Get in line; everyone wants to know. Nobles, scholars, Witch King's remains, Ewigegnade... They're all guessing what exactly Herkunftshorn's legacy will be.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Might? Power? Knowledge?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: What do you think, Federico?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...All I saw was an enormous mass of shadows that didn't exist in reality.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Herkunftshorn's death twenty-three years ago is the only fact of the matter.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: No matter how many images he fabricated for himself, or how many words he spoke, they were all simply echoes of the past.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: He may have failed to conquer death, but did manage to carve all his emotions into the void itself.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: His complacency, frustration, loathing, regret... and his expectations.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: He said our genesis is also our end, and that our abilities are also our incompetence.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.text: 'The invasion of chaos is inevitable.'
'The master of all existence will awaken.'

attributes.content: A difficult threat to decipher.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Perhaps this is somehow related to His Holiness's attitude. He was the one who entrusted me with the mission of bringing you back to Laterano.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Arturia, you said at the amphitheater that you never left Laterano of your own accord...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Mm-hm.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I freely admit the gaps in our laws, and that emotion may be a supplementary force we can use to help Laterano face this new threat. But it is undefinable, and bound to come with unknown risks.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Therefore, I will increase my vigilance over you in order to determine the subjective motivations and possible objective consequences of your actions.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: IE: I will shoot to kill if I find anything suspicious.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I am most grateful, Your Beatitude, for with your refined rationality, you are my most suitable executioner.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Alright, Federico. If you're not in a hurry to set off on your next journey, then take a good look at this sunset.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: This is the moment where Zwillingstürme reveals the pinnacle of its beauty. Such splendor is both fleeting and fragile. Soon, night will fall.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Do you still remember the question you once asked me?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Laterano seems to stand eternally white and flawless, shining with an everlasting radiance. So where is the first place to light up when the sun goes down?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Back then, I promised you that I would bring you to the highest point in Laterano for a look.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I know the answer.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I went to the top of the Basilica after I met with the Pope and received my sainthood.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Once night falls in the city, the streets to the right of the Tower of Revelations will be the first to light up.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I even looked into why that is the case.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The Lateran Office of Electrical Management has an integrated program for the city's public energy grid. The area I mentioned belongs to the district where the Tower of Revelations is located.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Alcide, the operator at the management office, is left-handed and has a mild case of obsessive-compulsive disorder. He starts from the leftmost switch on the control panel everyday.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The lights start from that street to the right of the Tower of Revelations, and then through the Notarial Hall and firearm workshops in Pagus Michaelion, to the Sunset Chapel in Pagus Saint Marcel, and then all the way to the chapel square.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: At night, the streetlights in Laterano illuminate in order—
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I should have expected as much. Your answer, as the most rational person I know, is also—
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: And they look just as nice as they were before.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I was going to tell you that I actually wasn't as frightened as you might have thought, back in that tiny room.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Even constant darkness and silence cannot obstruct the feelings between two people.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Of course, your findings aren't bad at all either.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: They reminded me that my question does indeed have a definite answer, somewhere out there.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The lights will turn on again. Even the halos on our heads have never gone out.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Light is a constant, while darkness is temporary.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: As for our emotions... Grief and joy may happen only in certain moments of our lives, but we can always feel them, all the time.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: They have never left us.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...Like how the sunset has never truly left this sky.
attributes.name: Arturia
